title: It's amazing how even in bots people want to troll
body:
If you haven't grinded before, the best way to do it is to go in a bots game, stack a lane with either 3(in a 3v3)or 5 people and push hard for a 7-10 min win.

But as usual, this is even too hard for the genius members of our community. Instead, in three seperate games today, the 3rd person decided to go on his own. Taking a 7-10 minute bot game into a 20+ minute clown fiesta where the bots end up more fed and end up wrecking, because the 2 people who went bot end up splitting cs/gold/xp while the enemy gets an adv.

This community is just unbelievable at times.

replies.body: You mean some people who are pre 30 don't know how to play the game and want to try something else out?  Shocker.

It's people who aren't listening to 2-4 others and instead doing their own thing.

Sorry but getting owned by bots aint fun.

At some point you'll realize that there are some people that don't like to be ordered around. If I started playing WoW and the people I was playing with kept telling me I was doing everything wrong and in the wrong areas, I wouldn't want to play for very long. Sometimes you want to figure things out for yourself. It's part of the experience.

You're playing bot games with legitimate new players, you have to expect that some of them won't have all the game knowledge you do, or even want to do things the way you think they should be done. If you want to level a new account, find some friends and grind the games together. Don't get mad at new players for not knowing the game already.

>At some point you'll realize that there are some people that don't like to be ordered around. 

That's fine with me, as long as they long as they don't like to actually win either.

These aren't new players. These are people in grinding rooms who won't fucking listen.

> [{quoted}](name=Great Muta,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=UWEx1iAq,comment-id=0000000000000000,timestamp=2016-11-03T23:02:09.458+0000)
>
> That's fine with me, as long as they long as they don't like to actually win either.
> 
> These aren't new players. These are people in grinding rooms who won't fucking listen.

These are public bot games. Everyone has a right to use these bot games.
If five people join the bot game and are ready to grind, great. If not, then you can't call out the person/people who refuse to grind. It's their game, they can play how they want as long as they are not violating the Terms of Use or Summoner's Code.
Players are not obligated to play the way you want them to play.
Bots don't wreck unless you're seriously new at the game, at which point you can't really blame them for not knowing the best thing to do.

If you try to do what we are doing and you don't get full team commitment they will. We did a 5v5 on bots and watched a Brand/Voli/Cass light up the 4 of us because we all shared 1 lane's XP and top refused to come.

If you don't have full team agreement, play right. Simple as that. Some people use bots to practice because they're newer, or want to practice a new champ or CSing. If you play like a moron instead of playing for real, that's on you.

We're here only to grind up. No other reason. Not like we are playing bots for pleasure.

It only takes 1 person in 3v3 to fuck everything up. I'm watching it now.

YOU'RE only there to grind. Other people have their own reasons to play and they're not accountable to you. That doesn't make them trolls. That makes you selfish. 
{{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

So why are they in a grinding chat room then?{{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

This is the strat:

1) All 3 in TT rush a lane. You hide in bush to get first blood. All 3 have to be there. Otherwise, the enemies hit 6 first and powerspike before you, and usually it's going to be an ADC. You have to have all 3 so that you can overcome the loss in XP/gold.

2) You TP on cannon minions to save them from dying and can take the first two turrets in about 5 mins.

3) You don't die 

You do this right, you win in 7-8 mins. You fuck up? 20 min game and possible loss depending on the team comps. Champs like Brand can fuck up an entire team because they are levels ahead and have a ton of CC. We also tend to pick ADC's as they can hit from further away but if someone like a Brand or a Graves gets fed, you get 3 hit. Also, most people doing this are under level 20, we are already naturally weaker.

> [{quoted}](name=Great Muta,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=UWEx1iAq,comment-id=0001000000000000,timestamp=2016-11-03T20:05:49.538+0000)
>
> We're here only to grind up. No other reason. Not like we are playing bots for pleasure.
> 
> It only takes 1 person in 3v3 to fuck everything up. I'm watching it now.

If you can't 1v5 bots on any difficulty setting...I would suggest practicing with bots {{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

You've obviously never done this before, so you don't understand.

I'm level 7-10. Only a couple of runes, a few masteries, no smite, no ignite. I own 3 whole champs. No matter who you are or how good you are, you are incredibly weak. It takes forever to clear any jungle camps and you are splitting creeps with teammates.

To do this right:

1) All 3 in TT rush a lane. You hide in bush to get first blood. All 3 have to be there. Otherwise, the enemies hit 6 first and powerspike before you, and usually it's going to be an ADC. You have to have all 3 so that you can overcome the loss in XP/gold.

1a) You suicide before minions spawn for 300 xtra damage on tower.

2) You TP on cannon minions to save them from dying and can take the first two turrets in about 5 mins.

3) You don't die 

If only 2 people come:

- Top lane makes little progress and ends up pushed back.

- Bottom lane might win a bit but it's going to take 20 mins due to the bot being an ADC. Both bot laners should be picking ADC's already to get this done faster. However, the bot is going to get extra xp from the 2v1. People like Graves can demolish Ashe.

- Win or lose, if the game goes over 13 mins, it defeats the whole purpose, as you aren't winning fast enough.
This might just be the funniest post I have ever read on the boards
alternatively play jax and 1v5 it down mid?
Let me know how that goes in Intermediate bots. The I-Bots game I played today featured the bots getting more CS than everyone but myself on the team.
Do it all the time when I play bots

Doubtful. Intermediate bots keep up level wise with you in midlane in the first 10-15 mins and once you take the T2 tower, you will be fighting off 2-3 enemies.

Intro bots? No problem. Beginner bots? Not sure. Intermediate bots? Nope.
Yeah, how dare new players play bots to learn how to play?! They should go to pvp or better yet rankeds to learn the basics of the game!
Bots is a horrible way to learn how to play because there is duo top, bots don't go for objectives and there's little reason to ward.
So, just like players in the division you belong in?
